intro: Psychotria hancorniifolia var. velutipes, commonly known as the velvet-leaved psychotria, is a species native to tropical regions of South America. It is a shrub or small tree characterized by its velvety, pubescent leaves that give it its common name. The leaves are typically elliptical or ovate, with a smooth or slightly serrated margin. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other species with similar morphological features.
